english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): When he would lead the people in eclipse prayer, he would begin by saying takbeer, then recite al-Hamd and a chapter from the Quran, reciting aloud at night or during the day, then perform ruku for about the length of what he recited, then raise his head from the ruku and say takbeer, continuing this five times. When he raised his head from the fifth ruku, he would say 'Sami' a-llahu liman hamidah' (Allah hears those who praise Him). When standing, he would not recite, then say takbeer and perform two prostrations. Then raise his head and do in the second rak'ah as he did in the first, saying takbeer whenever he raised his head from ruku in the four times, and saying 'Sami' a-llahu liman hamidah' on the fifth, and he would not recite after the fifth ruku

Then he would pray with the people like the prayer of the Eids, then give a sermon and reverse his garment (cloak), and ask forgiveness from Allah the Exalted one hundred times, raising his voice with it

english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): He said: In the prayer of fear, the leader divides his companions into two groups. One group stands opposite the enemy and takes their weapons, and he prays with the group that is with him one rak'ah and two prostrations. When the leader raises his head from the second prostration, they should position themselves behind them, and another group who have not yet prayed should come to pray with him. The first group retreats and takes the position of their companions. He then prays with the second group one rak'ah and two prostrations, then gives the salam. The two groups then stand, the first group completes one rak'ah and two prostrations then gives salam. They then stand at the position of their companions, and those who were opposite the enemy come forward and pray one rak'ah and two prostrations and give salam
